column4: I'm having issues with sharing my internet connection on a windows box to my ubuntu installation. It gets an IP address but fails to ping or do domain name lookups. Any ideas?
nmapp
what's your setup exactly? not sure i understand

I've got a wifi card in a windows PC, and I'm trying to share the connection with a ubuntu box over the wired network. The windows box has internet connection sharing enabled, and there's an IP handed to the ubuntu box but otherwise the link seems dead
um... what DNS servers does it assign, if any?
and what's the gateway machine?
what's the best way to check that?
cat /etc/resolv.conf, netstat -r
it says: destination - default - gateway - 192.168.0.1 Genmask - 0.0.0.0 Flags UG etc etc...
the genmask seems wrong, windows says it's 255.255.255.0
um, what's the gateway for the windows machine?
it's gateway to the internet, as in for the wifi nic? it's 192.169.2.1
hrm, so... your windows machine is the gateway for the ubuntu machine, yes? can you ping the outside world?
on the ubuntu machine? No... The windows machine, yes, that's what I'm using right now...
but you can ping the windows machine
no nothing at all, and I can't ping the ubuntu machine from the windows machine either
um, so does it actually get assigned an IP, or does it just time out and default to something?
no it actually gets an Ip, 192.168.0.182 (that's not too random is it?)
run dhclient by hand and find out
It works fine, I get a new IP, .93
can you ping 192.168.0.1?
no luck there
bizarre. i'm unsure how your windows connection sharing dealy works, so i dunno what more to do...
yeah, last time ubuntu 'got' it immediately...
